member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.BindSettings.Default
member.summary: The default settings for a bind. Sufficient for the majority of binds. Only the defined keys can be pressed and in order. Activated when the last key of the bind is released.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.BindSettings.OnFirstReleaseUnordered
member.summary: Only the defined keys can be pressed in any order. Activated when the last key of the bind is released.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.BindSettings.OnPress
member.summary: Only the defined keys can be pressed and in order. Activated when the last key of the bind is pressed down.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.BindSettings.OnPressUnordered
member.summary: Only the defined keys can be pressed and in order. Activated when the last key of the bind is pressed down.

member.name: T:MacroFramework.Commands.ActivationEventType
member.summary: Filters activations based on whether the current event was a keydown or a keyup event
member.remarks: You should be fine with most of the time.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.ActivationEventType.OnFirstRelease
member.summary: Only activates a keybind on the first key release after a keypress. E.g. if you press [A, B, C] and release the keys in order, only the binds with [A, B, C] will be activated.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.ActivationEventType.OnAnyRelease
member.summary: Activates a keybind on any key up event. E.g. if you press [A, B, C] and release the keys in order, the binds for [A, B, C], [B, C] and [C] will be activated.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.ActivationEventType.OnPress
member.summary: Activates a keybind on any key down event. E.g. if you press and hold [A, B, C] in order, the binds with [A], [A, B] and [A, B, C] will be activated.

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.ActivationEventType.Any
member.summary: ACtivates a keybind on any key event. Use with caution as binds with this option are activated twice, once on key down and once again on key up events. Use to determine whether the current event is a key down or up event.

member.name: T:MacroFramework.Commands.KeyMatchType
member.summary: Determines how keypress combinations are checked for matches

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.KeyMatchType.ExactKeyMatch
member.summary: Match occurs if all of the selected keys and no other keys are pressed

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.KeyMatchType.PartialMatch
member.summary: Match occurs if all of the selected keys are pressed

member.name: T:MacroFramework.Commands.KeyPressOrder
member.summary: Determines whether keys should be pressed in the give parameter order

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.KeyPressOrder.Ordered
member.summary: The will only activate if are pressed in order

member.name: F:MacroFramework.Commands.KeyPressOrder.Unordered
member.summary: The will activate if are pressed in any order

member.name: T:MacroFramework.Macros
member.summary: Static class used for starting the application with settings

member.summary: The application is running in a normal state

member.summary: The application is running in limited mode in which only certain are updated. Input is disabled.

member.summary: The application is paused and no or instances are automatically updated

member.summary: The current state of the application

member.summary: Callback used to catch exceptions globally
member.param: The object that raised the event
Indicates whether the common language runtime is terminating

member.name: P:MacroFramework.Macros.OnException
member.summary: Called on any exception which was not caught by a trycatch clause

member.name: P:MacroFramework.Macros.MainThread
member.summary: The thread on which the event loop and runs on.

member.name: P:MacroFramework.Macros.FunctionalityThread
member.summary: The thread on which the main loop runs on. The classes run on this thread.

member.name: P:MacroFramework.Macros.FunctionalityThreadJobQueue
member.summary: Enqueue a job here to execute some action on the . The jobs are executed in a try clause on the next main loop iteration.

member.summary: The last timestamp of the main update loop

member.name: P:MacroFramework.Macros.MainLoopIndex
member.summary: The index of the current running main loop

member.name: M:MacroFramework.Macros.Start(MacroFramework.MacroSetup,System.Boolean,System.Action)
member.summary: Starts the synchronous MacrosFramework application. Should be called from a method with an .
member.param: If true the application is set to
You can use this delegate to override the default event loop, which is without a form. Leave as null to use default.

member.name: M:MacroFramework.Macros.QueueJobOnMainThread(System.Action)
member.summary: Queues a job for the main STA thread which runs the event loop.
member.param: The job to add to the queue

member.name: M:MacroFramework.Macros.ExecuteMainThreadJobs
member.summary: Stops the event loop using , executes the jobs in the queue and restarts the event loop using .

member.summary: This exception was caught by the handler

member.summary: This exception was caught by the handler

member.name: T:MacroFramework.MacroSettings
member.summary: A settings class used to configure the framework

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.UseGlobalExceptionHandler
member.summary: Whether to use a global exception handler to catch uncaught exceptions. This can catch exception withing async Tasks. Default = true

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.HandleInjectedInputEvents
member.summary: If true injected events (e.g. virtual input events sent by processes) will be handled by the application. Use with care as handling injected events can cause unwanted behaviour. Default = false

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.CommandKey
member.summary: The dedicated key on the keyboard which activates the text command mode. Default =

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.GeneralBindKey
member.summary: A dedicated bind key which is always intercepted and tranformed into . Default =

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.CommandActivateKey
member.summary: The dedicated key on the keyboard which executes the current command mode. Default =

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.TextCommandTimeout
member.summary: The timeout after the last keypress after which command mode is canceled. Default = 2500ms

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.AllowKeyboardHook
member.summary: Whether to allow the keyboard hook. Default = true

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.AllowMouseHook
member.summary: Whether to allow the keyboard hook. Default = false

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.MainLoopTimestep
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds between every iteration of the main loop. Default = 10ms

member.name: F:MacroFramework.MacroSettings.KeyStateFixTimestep
member.summary: The can lose track of keystates if another application intercepts keys. This can cause keys to get stuck down and s stop working. Use this timestep to reset the keys using at regular intervals if no keys have been pressed for a while. Set to 0 to disable automatic keystate resets. Default = 20000 ms
